newsitem.title: HUNGARY: MOL, TVK pull Hungary's BUX lower.
newsitem.headline: MOL, TVK pull Hungary's BUX lower.

text.p: Hungarian share prices closed lower for the third successive day on the Budapest Stock Exchange on Tuesday but traders said the pace had slowed and the market could rebound soon.
The BUX index ended at 3,615.75 points, down 30.85. BUX index futures ended mixed, closing higher for two maturities, remaining steady for one and closing lower for three.
"The correction continued, and in addition in London all investors paid attention to the introduction of (Russia's) Gazprom shares," said Istvan Simon of Concorde Securities.
"This left its mark on the market here, but I think the end of the fall in Hungarian shares could be seen," he added.
Gazprom's introduction was one possible reason behind the low spot share turnover which totalled 654.2 million forints.
The two most actively traded issues, oil company MOL and chemicals company TVK both closed lower, although their falls were modest.
MOL closed at 1,640 forints, down 25, while TVK ended at 1,355 forints, down 10.
On Wednesday the Budapest bourse, and all other markets will be closed due to public holiday. The markets will resume trading on Thursday.
